problem_text:
Is every element of a nonabelian finite simple group a commutator of two elements of coprime orders?
The answer is known to be “yes” for the alternating groups (P. Shumyatsky, Forum Math., 27, no. 1 (2015), 575–583) and for PSL(2, q) (M. A. Pellegrini, P. Shumyatsky, Arch. Math., 99 (2012), 501–507).
Without the coprimeness condition, this is Ore’s conjecture proved in (M. W. Liebeck, E. A. O’Brien, A. Shalev, Pham Huu Tiep, J. Eur. Math. Soc., 12, no. 4 (2010), 939–1008).
P. Shumyatsky
